definition: to lower/to decrease/to reduce/to subtract/to diminish
low/beneath/to lower (one's head)/to let droop/to hang down/to incline

sentences.english: SPECT imaging will demonstrate decreased radiotracer uptake in the frontal and temporal lobes.
sentences.chinese: SPECT成像显示额颞叶放射性摄取减低。

sentences.english: Various initiatives continue to be implemented to reduce the risk of landslides.
sentences.chinese: 当局继续推行各项新措施，以减低山泥倾泻的风险。

sentences.english: Dolby noise reduction manufactured under the license from Dolby Laboratories Licensing Corporation.
sentences.chinese: 杜比噪音减低系经杜比实验证明公司授权制造。

sentences.english: A daily cup may reduce your chances of getting a cold.
sentences.chinese: 每天一杯酸奶能减低患感冒的几率。

sentences.english: Tubes and covers made of polyester, polyamide and other polymers for mechanical protection and sound reduction.
sentences.chinese: 能够起到机械保护和减低噪音效果的软管和管套。

sentences.english: Identify with whom you are triangulated and make an effort to reduce the level of emotional involvement with that individual.
sentences.chinese: 明确第三方的身份，尽量减低其个人情感掺和的程度。

sentences.english: For example, key money is used to minimize dissipation of rent under rent control. (2)
sentences.chinese: 例如，在价格管制下的匙金便是减低租值消散的方法。

sentences.english: The cold reduces pain and may decrease the effect of the heat on the tissue .
sentences.chinese: 冷水可以减轻疼痛并减低热对组织的作用。

sentences.english: Last, the trial and preparation cost can be reduced on average. (2)
sentences.chinese: 最后，平均试办及准备成本可以减低。

sentences.english: By stand-type profile possible to control the temperature difference in peak time.
sentences.chinese: 平滑的台形曲线，可减低峰值时的温度差。

sentences.english: The costs of such kind of proceedings should also be reduced as much as possible.
sentences.chinese: 这类法律程序的讼费也应该尽量减低。

sentences.english: A well diversified portfolio with dollar-cost-averaging approach can help lower risk.
sentences.chinese: 采用分散投资及平均成本法，能有助减低风险。

sentences.english: Furthermore, the current recessionary economy is mandating that businesses reduce sales and marketing costs.
sentences.chinese: 此外，如今衰退的经济要求企业减低营销费用。

sentences.english: "We cannot cut costs fast enough to offset that revenue loss, " he said.
sentences.chinese: 他说，“我们减低成本的速度赶不上收入下降的速度。

sentences.english: Faerie Fire will now stack with other armor reducing debuffs.
sentences.chinese: 精灵之火现在可以与另外一种减低防御的效果叠加。

sentences.english: Conclusions In later pregnancy, left cardiovascular diastole function slightly decreases.
sentences.chinese: 结论正常妊娠母体孕晚期舒张功能轻度减低。

definition: to make heavier/to emphasize/(of an illness etc) to become more serious/to aggravate (a bad situation)/to increase (a burden, punishment etc)
to defer/to postpone/to put off/to retard/to slow sth down
